</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	convertible promissory notes were issued in July 2008 by Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. The notes accrued interest at 5% per annum until maturity and accrued interest at 7% after
	maturity. In the event Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. received aggregate gross proceeds that equaled or exceeded U.S. $4,000,000 from a financing that includes the offering of the notes including conversion of Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s existing debt, the principal amount of these notes and the accrued but unpaid interest would automatically be converted into shares of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s
	Series&nbsp;D preferred shares, at a per share price equal to the lower of U.S. $4.00 and the lowest sales price of the Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s preferred shares in relevant prior offerings.
	At any time prior to the occurrence of a mandatory conversion, the note holder could convert the principal and accrued but unpaid interest into shares of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s
	Series&nbsp;D preferred shares at a per share price equal to the lower of U.S. $4.00 and the lowest sales price of the Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s preferred stock in relevant prior offerings. On
	January&nbsp;20, 2015, the convertible promissory noteholders exercised the option, conditional upon the Company's admission on AIM, to convert U.S. $200,000, of convertible promissory notes and
	U.S. $78,787 of accrued interest into shares of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. Upon the Company's admission to AIM, the shares were converted into ordinary shares of the Company under the terms of the
	Motif Merger Agreement, described in note&nbsp;16.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	notes payable to the shareholders are demand notes from a shareholder of the Group&#151;Amphion Innovations&nbsp;plc and its subsidiary, Amphion Innovations US,&nbsp;Inc.
	At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the notes accrued interest at 5% per annum. If the principal or accrued interest remained outstanding at such time as Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. concluded an equity
	financing that equaled or exceeded one million U.S. dollars, the note holder could convert all or part of the principal balance plus accrued but unpaid interest into the securities of Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. issued in the financing at a conversion rate equal to the price per security at which the securities are issued in the financing. On April&nbsp;1, 2015, Amphion
	Innovations&nbsp;plc converted U.S. $6,000,000 of notes and accrued interest into shares of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. The new notes, which accrue interest at 7% per annum, mature on
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 and can be converted into ordinary shares of the Company at the rate of U.S. $0.2447 per share, and have been accounted for under IFRS&nbsp;2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2015, Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. entered into four convertible promissory notes totaling U.S. $704,210 as part of a pre-AIM admission fundraising. Upon the Company's
	admission to AIM, the notes were converted into 2,612,766 ordinary shares of the Company. The Company issued 499,570 warrants to noteholders with an exercise price of 20&nbsp;pence per share. The
	expiration date for 176,246 of the warrants was December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2016 for 323,324 of the warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Share-based payments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. issued options and warrants to employees, directors, consultants and note holders. Under the Merger Agreement between Motif Acquisition Sub,&nbsp;Inc. and
	Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc., described in note&nbsp;16, each outstanding share option granted by Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. was assumed and converted by the Company into options to subscribe
	for ordinary shares of the Company. The
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=225,EFW="2230255",CP="MOTIF BIO PLC",DN="1",CHK=415360,FOLIO='F-37',FILE='DISK126:[16ZBI1.16ZBI15901]FS15901A.;44',USER='DSLOAN',CD=';8-NOV-2016;16:09' -->
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FS15901_1_38">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_BG15901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Share-based payments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	number
	of share options and the exercise prices have been adjusted to reflect the reverse stock split in the capital of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. on March&nbsp;13, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	December&nbsp;4, 2014, Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. adopted a Share Option Plan (the "Plan") under which options can be granted to employees, consultants, and directors. Under the
	Plan 9,304,575 (post-reverse stock split) options were issued in 2014 that will vest over three years and expire ten years from the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company adopted a Share Option Plan (the "New Plan") on April&nbsp;1, 2015. This New Plan replaces Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.'s Plan. There were no changes to the fair value of
	share options granted under the Plan with the only change being to grant the holders shares in the Company rather than Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. upon exercising options. The exercise price for
	each option will be established in the discretion of the Board provided that the exercise price for each option shall not be less than the nominal value of the relevant shares if the options are to be
	satisfied by a new issue of shares by the Company and provided that the exercise price per share for an option shall not be less than the fair market value of a share on the effective date of grant of
	the option. Options will be exercisable at such times or upon such events and subject to such terms, conditions, performance criteria, and restrictions as determined by the Board on grant date.
	However, no option shall be exercisable after the expiration
	of ten years after the effective date of grant of the option. In 2015, 1,000,000 options were issued under the New Plan that will expire in ten years and vest over three years with no further
	performance criteria.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	options exercised, the weighted average share price in 2015 was U.S. $0.22 (2014: U.S. $0.10).
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>

	fair value of options and warrants has been valued using the Black Scholes option pricing model. Volatility has been estimated by reference to historical stock price data of the
	Company. The assumptions for each option grant were as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Share-based payments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	range of exercise prices of the options at December&nbsp;31, 2015 were U.S. $0.14-$0.87 (December&nbsp;31, 2014: U.S. $0.14-$4.18). The weighted average remaining contractual
	life of the outstanding options is 7.8&nbsp;years. The options will be equity settled. The share price used for the share option plan prior to
	being traded on AIM was based on management's assessment of the valuation of the Group given the net assets and future potential of the Group at the time of granting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	total expense recognized for the years arising from stock-based payments are as follows:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company was incorporated, as Motif, Ltd., on November&nbsp;20, 2014 with 100 ordinary shares of 1&nbsp;pence each, which was subscribed for unpaid. The shares were transferred
	upon capitalization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;1, 2015, the Company issued 250,000 ordinary shares to an investor for its investment in the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 36,726,242 ordinary shares to the Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. shareholders as consideration for the transfer of the entire issued common
	stock of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-39
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=227,EFW="2230255",CP="MOTIF BIO PLC",DN="1",CHK=348135,FOLIO='F-39',FILE='DISK126:[16ZBI1.16ZBI15901]FS15901A.;44',USER='DSLOAN',CD=';8-NOV-2016;16:09' -->
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_FS15901_1_40">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_BG15901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. Share capital (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 9,805,400 ordinary shares to the former Nuprim shareholders as consideration for the Acquisition of Nuprim Assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 657,894 ordinary shares to a creditor of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. in payment of the balance due.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 2,612,766 shares to the pre-admission note holders upon conversion of the convertible promissory notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 14,186,140 ordinary shares upon its admission on AIM at the price of 20&nbsp;pence per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, 186,808 ordinary shares were issued upon the exercise of options and 176,246 ordinary shares were issued upon the exercise of warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	July&nbsp;21, 2015, the Company placed 44,000,000 new ordinary shares at a placing price of 50&nbsp;pence per ordinary share for total net proceeds of &pound;20,737,583
	(U.S. $32,340,260).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Share
	premium represents the excess over nominal value of the fair value consideration received for equity shares net of expenses of the share issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Retained
	deficit represents accumulated losses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Group re-organization reserve arose when the Company became the parent of the Group. The transaction, falling as it does outside the scope of IFRS&nbsp;3, has been accounted for as
	a group re-organization and not a business combination. The re-organization reserve can be derived by calculating the difference between the nominal value of the shares in the Company issued to the
	former shareholders in Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. and the share capital and share premium of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. at the date of the merger.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	minor fair value adjustment is also included in the reorganization reserve. This represents the uplift to fair value of the initial deposit shares in Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.
	issued to the shareholders of Nuprim on the execution of the agreed upon term sheet of the Acquisition of Nuprim Assets (Note&nbsp;9), which were converted to shares on admission to AIM.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. Financial assets and financial liabilities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Group holds the following financial instruments:
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	17. Group reorganization
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;18, 2015, Motif Bio Limited incorporated a Delaware subsidiary, Motif Acquisition Sub,&nbsp;Inc. On March&nbsp;27, 2015, Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc., Motif Bio
	Limited, and Motif Acquisition Sub,&nbsp;Inc. entered into an agreement where, upon admission to AIM, Motif Acquisition Sub,&nbsp;Inc. merged with and into Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. and Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. continued as the surviving entity and became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	former Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. shareholders were issued 36,726,242 ordinary shares in the Company in exchange for their common stock in Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. so that
	the former Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. shareholders own an equivalent number of ordinary shares in of the Company as the number of shares of common stock that they had previously owned in Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. All outstanding, unexercised, and vested stock options over shares of common stock in Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. were converted into options over ordinary shares in the
	Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	directors consider the acquisition of the entire issued common stock of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. by the Company to be a group re-organization and not a business combination and
	to fall outside the scope of IFRS&nbsp;3. The transaction is accounted for as if both entities have always been combined, using book values, with no fair value adjustments made nor goodwill
	recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BENEFICIAL_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_BENEFICIAL_OWNERS_3"></A>

	18. Subsidiaries
</B>

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	principal activity of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. is proprietary drug discovery research and development.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	19. Related party transactions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Transactions with Amphion Innovations&nbsp;plc and Amphion Innovations US,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, Amphion Innovations&nbsp;plc owned 26.08% of the issued ordinary shares in Motif Bio&nbsp;plc. In
	addition, the Amphion Group has provided funding for the activities of Motif
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;1, 2015, the Company entered into an Advisory and Consultancy Agreement with Amphion Innovations US,&nbsp;Inc. The consideration for the services is U.S. $120,000 per
	annum. In the event that the Company raises a minimum of &pound;5,000,000 in gross proceeds on AIM admission or a secondary raise, a one-time payment of U.S. $300,000 will be paid to Amphion
	Innovations US,&nbsp;Inc. This amount was paid on July&nbsp;21, 2015. The agreement is for an initial period of twelve months and will automatically renew each year on the anniversary date unless
	either party notifies the other by giving 90&nbsp;days written notice prior to expiration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;1, 2015, the Company entered into a Consultancy Agreement with Amphion Innovations&nbsp;plc for the services Robert Bertoldi, an employee of Amphion
	Innovations&nbsp;plc, to provide services to the Group. The consideration for the services is U.S. $5,000 per month. On November&nbsp;1, 2015, the consideration increased to U.S. $180,000
	annually. The agreement is for an initial period of twelve months and will automatically renew each year on the anniversary date unless either party notifies the other by giving 90&nbsp;days written
	notice prior to expiration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Transactions with key management personnel
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gains on settlement of contract disputes include U.S. $5,027 (2014: U.S. $284,842) resulting from a settlement agreement regarding
	salary owed to a director from his term as CEO.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	directors are responsible for planning, directing, and controlling the activities of the Company. Transactions between the Company and its key management personnel and are disclosed
	in notes&nbsp;5 and 6 above.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	20. Post balance sheet events
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2016, the Group appointed U.S. healthcare investment bank MTS Health Partners to advise on its future financing options within the U.S. market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2016, Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. entered into an agreement with BAL Pharma Consulting,&nbsp;LLC for the development and planning of the commercialization of iclaprim.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2016, the Group initiated dosing in the iclaprim Phase&nbsp;3 trials for the treatment of acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI). These clinical trials
	will assess the efficacy and safety of iclaprim compared to a standard of care antibiotic, vancomycin, for the treatment of ABSSSI.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2016, the Group appointed specialist adviser the Fulford Group&nbsp;Ltd. to assist Motif in developing and implementing strategies to commercialize iclaprim in territories
	outside of the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2016, Jonathan Gold, a non-executive director, entered into a consulting agreement with Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2016, Pete A. Meyers and Rajesh B. Shukla were appointed as Chief Financial Officer and Vice President Clinical Operations, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-43
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Until&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2016, 25&nbsp;days after the date
	of this prospectus, all dealers that effect transactions in these securities, whether
	or not participating in this offering, may be required to deliver a prospectus. This is in addition to the dealers' obligation to deliver a prospectus when acting as underwriters and with respect to
	their unsold allotments or subscriptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;MARGIN-LEFT:18PT;">
<FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BLANK LINE TO FORCE PARA -->
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<EFX_PART_II>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_II"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_JA15901_PART_II_INFORMATION_NOT_REQUIRED_IN_THE_PROSPECTUS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA15901_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PART II
<BR>
<BR>
	INFORMATION NOT REQUIRED IN THE PROSPECTUS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_INDEMNIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_INDEMNIFICATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_JA15901_ITEM_6__INDEMNIFICATION_OF_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA15901_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Indemnification Of Directors And Officers
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Registrant's memorandum and articles of association contain indemnification for the benefit of the Registrant's directors and
	executive officers to the fullest extent permitted by English law. However, as to the Registrant's directors and company secretary, this
	indemnity is limited by the Companies Act, which prescribe that an advance commitment to indemnify only permits a company to pay the costs or discharge the liability of a director or company secretary
	where judgment is given in favor of the director or company secretary in any civil or criminal action in respect of such costs or liability, or where an English court grants relief because the
	director or company secretary acted honestly and reasonably and ought fairly to be excused. Any provision whereby an English company seeks to commit in advance to indemnify its directors or company
	secretary over and above the limitations imposed by the Companies Act will be void, whether contained in its articles of association or any contract between the Registrant and the director or company
	secretary. This restriction does not apply to the Registrant's executive officers who are not directors, the company secretary or other persons who would be considered "officers" within the meaning of
	the Companies Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Registrant is permitted under its articles of association and the Companies Act to purchase directors' and officers' liability insurance, as well as other types of insurance, for its
	directors, officers, employees and agents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Registrant has entered into indemnification agreements with each of its directors and officers. These indemnification agreements may subject to the provisions of the Companies Act
	require the Registrant, among other things, to indemnify its directors and officers for some expenses, including attorneys' fees, judgments, fines and settlement amounts incurred by a director or
	officer in any action or proceeding arising out of his or her service as one of its directors or officers, or any of its subsidiaries or any other company or enterprise to which the person provides
	services at its request.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reference
	is made to Item&nbsp;9 of the Registrant's undertakings with respect to liabilities arising under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Securities Act. Reference is
	also made to the form of underwriting agreement filed as Exhibit&nbsp;1.1 to this registration statement for the indemnification agreements between the Registrant and its underwriters.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_INDEMNIFICATION>
<EFX_SALE_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES>
<A NAME="FIS_SALE_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_JA15901_ITEM_7__RECENT_SALES_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA15901_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recent Sales Of Unregistered Securities
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the past three years, we have issued and sold the securities described below without registering such securities under the
	Securities Act. None of these transactions involved any U.S. public offering. We believe that each of the following issuances was exempt from registration under the Securities Act in reliance on
	Regulation&nbsp;S under the Securities Act regarding sales by an issuer in offshore transactions, Regulation&nbsp;D under the Securities Act, Rule&nbsp;701 under the Securities Act or pursuant
	to Section&nbsp;4(a)(2) of the Securities Act regarding transactions not involving a public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2014, 550,000 shares were issued to directors and former employees of the Company upon the exercise of share options for aggregate proceeds of $33,000 to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;12, 2015, Motif BioSciences Inc. issued convertible promissory notes to four investors for a total of &pound;470,298 (U.S.$704,210) (the "Noteholders"), the terms
	of which provided that the notes would automatically convert into our ordinary shares upon our admission to AIM.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;1, 2015, the Company issued 250,000 ordinary shares to an investor as consideration for their investment of &pound;50,000 (U.S.$74,620) in the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	II-1
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=233,EFW="2230255",CP="MOTIF BIO PLC",DN="1",CHK=755863,FOLIO='II-1',FILE='DISK126:[16ZBI1.16ZBI15901]JA15901A.;24',USER='DSLOAN',CD=';8-NOV-2016;16:09' -->
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_PAGE_JA15901_1_2">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_BG15901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 14,186,140 ordinary shares in a public offering to European investors upon its admission on AIM at the price of 20&nbsp;pence per share for
	net proceeds to the Company of &pound;2.5&nbsp;million (U.S.$3.3&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 642,384 warrants with an exercise price of 20&nbsp;pence per share to its nominated advisor, 642,384 warrants with an exercise price of
	20&nbsp;pence per share to its broker, and 82,321 warrants with an exercise price of 20&nbsp;pence per share to MC Services AG, a fundraising advisor in partial consideration for their
	participation in the Company's AIM admission.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 36,726,242 ordinary shares to the former Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. shareholders in exchange for their shares of Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. (constituting the entire issued and outstanding common stock of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc.) to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, in connection with the reorganization, the Company issued a $1,471,700 convertible note to Amphion Innovations plc and a $2,079,085.63 convertible note to
	Amphion Innovations US, Inc. for amounts previously advanced to Motif BioSciences Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 9,805,400 ordinary shares to the former shareholders of Nuprim, as consideration for their shares of Nuprim in the merger of Motif
	BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. and Nuprim. The Company also issued 9,432,033 warrants to the former Nuprim shareholders with an exercise price of 20&nbsp;pence per share as part of the merger
	consideration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 2,612,766 shares to the Noteholders upon conversion of their convertible promissory notes. The Company also issued 499,570 warrants to these
	Noteholders with an exercise price of 20&nbsp;pence per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company issued 657,894 ordinary shares to a creditor of Motif BioSciences&nbsp;Inc. in satisfaction of an outstanding balance due of $200,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;23, 2015, the Company issued 1,082,384 warrants with an exercise price of 50&nbsp;pence per share to Zeus Capital Management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	July&nbsp;22, 2015, the Company issued 44,000,000 ordinary shares in a public offering to European investors for net proceeds to the Company of &pound;20.7&nbsp;million
	(U.S.$32.3&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, the Company issued 1,000,000 share options to employees of the Company under its Share Option Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, the Company issued 186,808 ordinary shares to former employees and a former director of the Company upon the exercise of share options for aggregate proceeds of $51,003 to
	the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, the Company issued 176,246 ordinary shares to former convertible promissory note holders upon the exercise of warrants for aggregate proceeds of $53,267 to the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;14, 2016, the Company issued 409,000 ordinary shares to a convertible promissory noteholder as consideration for its agreement to forego interest payments under its
	note after June&nbsp;30, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2016, the Company has issued 3,261,577 share options to employees of the Company under its Share Option Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_SALE_OF_UNREGISTERED_SECURITIES>

<EFX_UNDERTAKINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_UNDERTAKINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_JA15901_ITEM_9__UNDERTAKINGS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230255ZF-1A_HTM_TOC_JA15901_5">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Undertakings
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	undersigned registrant hereby undertakes to provide to the underwriter at the closing specified in the underwriting agreements, certificates in such
	denominations and registered in such names as required by the underwriter to permit prompt delivery to each purchaser.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(h)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Insofar
	as indemnification for liabilities arising under the Securities Act of 1933 may be permitted to directors, officers and controlling persons of the
	registrant pursuant to the foregoing provisions, or otherwise, the registrant has been advised that in the opinion of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission such indemnification is against public
	policy as expressed in the Act and is, therefore, unenforceable. In the event that a claim for indemnification against such liabilities (other than the payment by the registrant of expenses incurred
	or paid by a director, officer, or controlling person of the registrant in the successful defense of any action, suit or proceeding) is asserted by such director, officer or controlling person in
	connection with the securities being registered, the registrant will, unless in the opinion of its counsel the matter has been settled by controlling precedent, submit to a court of appropriate
	jurisdiction the question of whether such indemnification by it is against public policy as expressed in the Act and will be governed by the final adjudication of such issue.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(i)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	undersigned registrant hereby undertakes that:
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	purposes of determining any liability under the Securities Act of 1933, the information omitted from the form of prospectus filed as part of this
	registration statement in reliance upon Rule&nbsp;430A and contained in a form of prospectus filed by the Registrant pursuant to Rule&nbsp;424(b)(1) or (4)&nbsp;or 497(h) under the Securities
	Act shall be deemed to be part of this registration statement as of the time it was declared effective.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the purpose of determining any liability under the Securities Act of 1933, each post-effective amendment that contains a form of prospectus shall be
	deemed to be a new registration statement relating to the securities offered therein, and the offering of such securities at that time shall be deemed to be the initial bona fide offering thereof.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>

	meets all of the requirements for filing on Form&nbsp;F-1 and has duly caused this Amendment No.&nbsp;10 to the Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;F-1 to be signed on its behalf by the
	undersigned, thereunto duly authorized, in New York, New York on November&nbsp;14, 2016.

<EFX_EXHIBIT_5>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_5"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit 5.1
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<IMG WIDTH="180" HEIGHT="44" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/11/14/0001047469-16-016655_G112593KOI001.JPG">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	14 November&nbsp;2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Motif Bio plc
<BR>
	One Tudor Street
<BR>
	London
<BR>
	EC4Y 0AH
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Dear Sirs:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have acted as English legal advisers to Motif Bio plc, a public limited company incorporated in England and Wales with company number 09320890 (the &#147;Company&#148;), in connection with the issue of up to 100 million ordinary shares of one penny each in the capital of the Company (the &#147;New Shares&#148;). The New Shares are to be offered and sold by the Company (the &#147;Offering&#148;) in the form of: (i)&nbsp;American Depositary Shares (the &#147;ADSs&#148;), with each ADS representing 20 New Shares; (ii)&nbsp;New Shares, to subscribers in Europe; (iii)&nbsp;warrants to purchase ADSs (the &#147;ADS Warrants&#148;); and (iv)&nbsp;warrants to purchase&#160; New Shares (the &#147;New Share Warrants&#148;, together with the ADSs, the New Shares and the ADS Warrants, the &#147;Securities&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This opinion letter is being given in connection with the registration statement (as amended through the date hereof (the &#147;
<B>
	Registration Statement
</B>
	&#148;)) on Form&nbsp;F-1 (File No.&nbsp;333-212491), originally filed by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission on 13 July&nbsp;2016 pursuant to the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;
<B>
	Securities Act
</B>
	&#148;), and the rules&nbsp;and regulations promulgated thereunder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The existing issued ordinary shares of the Company are admitted to trading on AIM, a market operated by London Stock Exchange plc. Application will be required to be made for the New Shares and the New Shares underlying the ADSs to also be admitted to trading on AIM. For the avoidance of doubt, application will not be made for the New Share Warrants to be traded on AIM. No application will be made for the New Shares underlying the ADS Warrants to be traded on AIM at this time; however, once the ADS Warrants are exercised and the New Shares underlying the associated ADSs are allotted and issued, application will be made for the New Shares underlying such ADSs to be admitted to trading on AIM.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	1.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	INTRODUCTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<I>
	Documents Reviewed
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 35.45PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the purpose of this opinion letter, we have reviewed the following documents:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Registration Statement; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	copies, as appearing on the Company&#146;s file at the Companies Registry, of:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.2.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Company&#146;s Certificate of Incorporation dated 20 November&nbsp;2014;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	Reed Smith LLP is a limited liability partnership registered in England and Wales with registered number OC303620 and its registered office at The Broadgate Tower, 20 Primrose Street, London EC2A 2RS.
<BR>
	Reed Smith LLP is authorised and regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority. A list of the members of Reed Smith LLP, and their professional qualifications, is available at the registered office.
<BR>
	The term partner is used to refer to a member of Reed Smith LLP, or a partner of an associated entity, or an employee of equivalent standing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 5.4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	Reed Smith LLP is associated with Reed Smith LLP of Delaware, USA and the offices referred to below are offices of either Reed Smith LLP or Reed Smith LLP of Delaware, USA.
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.2.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the re-registration documents for the Company&#146;s re-registration from a private company to a public company, dated 1 April&nbsp;2015;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.2.3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the memorandum and articles of association of the Company as adopted by resolution of the shareholders of the Company on 26 January&nbsp;2015 (the &#147;
<B>
	Memorandum and Articles
</B>
	&#148;);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.1.3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the shareholder resolutions passed at the general meeting of the Company on 1 August&nbsp;2016 resolving, inter alia, to give the directors of the Company authority to allot ordinary shares and dis-apply pre-emption rights up to a nominal amount of &#163;1 million (equating, because ordinary shares in the Company have a nominal value of one penny each, to 100 million ordinary shares) pursuant to the Offering (the &#147;
<B>
	Shareholder Resolutions
</B>
	&#148;);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">

	1.1.4

	minutes of a meeting of the board of directors of the Company held on 11 July&nbsp;2016 at which it was resolved to proceed with the Offering and to resolve to allot the New Shares (conditional on admission of the New Shares to AIM) (the &#147;
<B>
	Board Resolutions
</B>
	&#148; and together with the Shareholder Resolutions, the &#147;
<B>

</B>
	&#148;).

	For the purpose of this opinion letter, we have reviewed and undertaken the following searches and enquiries:

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<B>

</B>
	&#148;) or any corporate records of the Company or the Group nor made any other enquiries concerning the Company or the Group.

<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">

	3.1.8
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">

	that there are no provisions of the laws of any jurisdiction outside England that would have any implication for the opinions we express and that, insofar as the laws of any jurisdiction outside England, the State of New York and the federal securities laws of the United States may be relevant to this opinion letter, such laws have been and will be complied with.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	OPINIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Based upon the foregoing, subject to any matters not disclosed to us and subject to the qualifications set out below, we give the following opinions in respect of the Company:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.1.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Securities have been duly authorised for allotment and issue;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.1.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Securities will, when the names of the holders of such Securities are entered in the relevant register of the Company (being the Register of ADS holders for the ADSs, the Register of Members for the New Shares, the Register of ADS Warrantholders for the ADS Warrants and the Register of Warrantholders for the New Share Warrants) and subject to the receipt by the Company of the aggregate issue price in respect of all the Securities, be validly issued, fully paid and no further amount may be called thereon;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.1.3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the issue of the ADS Warrants and the New Share Warrants will create binding obligations upon the Company; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.1.4
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the ordinary shares underlying the ADS Warrants and the New Share Warrants, when issued and sold by the Company and delivered by the Company against receipt of the exercise price therefor, in accordance with and in the manner described in the Registration Statement, will be validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the purpose of this opinion, the term &#147;non-assessable&#148;, when used to describe the liability of a person as the registered holder of shares has no clear meaning under the laws of the England and Wales, so we have assumed those words to mean that holders of such ordinary shares, having fully paid all amounts due on such ordinary shares, are under no personal liability to contribute to the assets and liabilities of the Company in their capacities purely as holders of such ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	QUALIFICATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	This opinion letter is subject to the following qualifications:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the enquiries at the Central Registry of Winding-Up Petitions referred to in paragraph 1.2.2 above, relate only to compulsory winding up petitions presented to and winding up orders made in, the High Court in London and District Registries in England and Wales and to
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	4
<A NAME="A2230255ZEX-5_1_HTM_11259-3-KO_PB_4_222922_5335">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=4,EFW="2230255",CP="MOTIF BIO PLC",DN="2",CHK=275160,FOLIO='4',FILE="DISK125:[16ZBI3.16ZBI15903]11259-3-KO_ZBI15903.CHC",USER="LGADISH",CD='NOV 12 00:55 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	applications for administration presented to and administration orders made in, the High Court in London. It is not capable of revealing conclusively whether or not:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1.1.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	a winding up petition or administration application has in fact been presented at the relevant court, as details of the petition/application may not have been entered on the records of the Central Registry of Winding Up Petitions in time to be disclosed by our enquiry;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1.1.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	an application has been made or a petition has been presented for an administration or a winding up order in any court other than the High Court. We have not made enquiries of any County Court as to whether an application or petition for an administration/winding up order has been presented to, or an administration or winding up order has been made by, such County Court against the Company; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.6IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.6IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1.1.3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	a notice of appointment of an administrator has been filed in either the High Court or the County Court by the Company or by any secured creditor of the Company; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 1.0IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.1.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	searches with the Registrar of Companies in England and Wales are not capable of revealing definitively whether or not a winding up petition or an application for an administration order has been presented. Notices of a winding up order made or resolutions passed or an administration order made, or an administrative receiver or a receiver appointed may not be filed with the Registrar of Companies in England and Wales immediately.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We hereby consent to the filing of this opinion letter as an exhibit to the Registration Statement and to the references to this firm under the caption &#147;Legal Matters&#148; contained in the Registration Statement. In giving such consent, we do not admit that we are in the category of persons whose consent is required under Section&nbsp;7 of the Securities Act or the Rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We hereby consent to the use in this Amendment No.&nbsp;10 to the Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;F-1 of Motif Bio plc of our report dated May&nbsp;16, 2016, except with respect to our opinion on the consolidated financial statements insofar as it relates to the matters that raise&nbsp;substantial&nbsp;doubt&nbsp;about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern described in Note 1 as to which the date is October&nbsp;31, 2016, relating to the consolidated financial statements, which appears in such Registration Statement. We also consent to the reference to us under the heading &#147;Experts&#148; in such Registration Statement.
</FONT>
